title: Damage in League is kinda unruly, here's my 2 cents
body:
Mages should be gated by ~~mana/energy~~ **CDR**. ~~Dota does this well~~. Skills for mages should be thought about, not spammed. 

Assassins should be gated by delays. Zed's ult, LeBlanc's passive, Fizz's ult, etc. Not like Rengar's or Talon's ult. 

ADCs should be gated by time. They shouldn't be able to burst as well as the other classes, instead, focus on sustained damage.

Tanks should be gated by clarity. Their damage should be easy to see coming, but not necessarily easy to dodge, e.g. Galio R, Maokai R, etc.

Supports should be gated by allies. Supports should excel when they can work THROUGH allies, not necessarily working FOR the allies. Stuff like Zilean Q, Lulu EQ combo, etc.

Thoughts? I'm still trying to get orientated around this.

EDIT: This is very simplified. I also changed mages from mana/energy to CD, because, well, Sire Hippington is right.

replies.body:
I don't agree with mages and the heavy mana gateing.
Obiously some kits need gateing either just for lane or even later on, but in general, heavy gateing through mana leads to a very passive and boring playstyle as you only comit your preccious mana if you really are sure to get something from it. The insane mana gateing is one off the things i dislike most in dota.
You also shouldn't forget that in dota, even mages have well scaleing AAs, some of them like lina even have pretty huge dps, so they can afford to hold back their spells.
Imo mages should rather work like in S2, when you actually had to decide between cdr for dps and raw burst damage. They should be more gated by CDs **and opportunity**

Assasins imo should not be designed about 100-0 combos, wether it's delayed or not, it always leads to a binary scenario where either the victim or the assasin gets rather frustraited(Zed always had the delay, and by times was the most banned champ in the game even while not op). Imo they should focus more on hit n run, beeing able to unload decent damage rather fast, and then disengage for a second round soon after, while skirmishers should have an ok opening burst, but good dps and stickiness aswell as the means to avoid some damage so they can use their dps.

Fully agree on adc, they need more rampup mechaincs and shouldn't have burst mechanics like shiv on their dps items. It's ok if they can built ad/cdr/pen and become ad-casters that have burst/poke, but they need to sacrifice dps for that. 
I also really dislike current huricane, crit+aoe should not go together. Old hurricane was a lot better design, you could go for on-hit builts with it for aoe damage but loose out in the crit scaleing vs singletaregts, so there was more of a tradeof. They also should have to sacrifice a bit more damage for survivabillity than they currently do, and lifesteal items should NEVER have anti burst/anti cc on them, they should counter their own counter.
But mostly, crit needs to go or geting reworled into something else, but the current RNG has no place in a competetive game. Pure luck should never decide wether you win a trade/fight or not.

Supports imo should be less designed as slaves to the adc and just the adc but rather more as supports **for the entier team**, with maybe some beeing more focused on supporting adc, some on helping melee fighters and some on boosting mages. I also do think that (some)supports should be allowed to be somewaht selfsufficient, especial earlyer in the game. It really helps strategic diversity if there are supportive champs that can perform in a sololane while getting his best perormance once he joins up with others. And yes, i'm all for supports working more through others rather than for them with stuff like namies W or Ivern E.

Tanks should have less damage+cc, right now they bring to much of both. Befor the tankreworks slapped aditional cc on every tank, it was fine for them to do the damage they did, but now it's just to much output overall. They also could use a clearer focuse on either engage/dive or peeling. Prettymuch all tanks right now can do both so there is little varity. I also think that hard cc shouldn't be as plenty and spamable as it is. It needs to be either gated by high CDs and/or by Opportunity/Conditions. Maokai spaming a strong aoe knockbak every 3 sec or Zac haveing 3 displaces in his kit with not to high cd on two of them is just to much. It's ok for a tank to be disruptive, but there always is a line that shouldn't get crossed, and the old tanks imo were well within line, they had good cc to be disruptive, but weren't overbearing with it.

Wut. Tanks bring dmg? And too much at that? Sorry but what? And no cho is not a tank. He is something unique.

Tanks have high base damages so they can trade in lane, push minions, be a threat in teamfight, etc.

It's definitely not to the level of assassins or ADCs, but tanks definitely do a decent amount of damage.
They need to have those base dmg or else the wouldnt be able to lane. Its not unbearable. Their dmg is relative only at early.
I mean I just started playing Maokai, and even though I don't do like massive damage, most tanks have low enough cooldowns that you can just whack people down in a reasonable time frame.
They cant do it consistently though. Even with catalyst.
tank cooldowns usually longer than other classess mages assassins adcs
As someone who plays Lux a lot, Maokai's Q feels absurdly spammy.  Which tanks have long cooldowns?  I play a lot of Poppy, Sejuani and Sion too, and they all have relatively low cooldowns.

tanks usually have 1 short cooldown spell and 2 longs and an extremely long ult. and even then its not that much less than any mage if it even touches a mage cooldowns. tanks also usually have gimped damage or cc on said short cooldown spell unlike mages dont usually have low damage on their spammable spells and they have longer range to leverage it.

Riot inverts base stats depending on how champions are supposed to build. That's why traditionally Tanks often have higher offensive base stats, while squishies have higher defensive base stats.

That way tanks are capable of trading/farming while they build resists. And carries don't get 1-shot while they build AD/AP.
so squshies arent squishy and tanks are..... makes sense.
tanks deal bruiser dmg right now or since forever while being more tanky and bring more CC.
No? After laning phase their dmg becomes irrelevant UNLESS you have fallen behind.

For mages, I would say just remove CDR. As it is now, getting to 40% is a given, not a choice. I'm fine with not mana gating them. They're mages, using spells is the point. But missing should have a consequence and they should have to decide to use their spells for one thing or another, not have enough CDR for both. Unless they sacrificed power to do both.


For Assassins, I'd argue that over the course of 20 seconds (which is an absurd time for any fight in league at the moment) DPS should be equal to a mage or adc. But mages and ADC do the same DPS over that 20 seconds; assasins do 60-80% in the first 5-10 seconds, and 20-40% is the back half. 
I'm using exaggerated times to get the point across better. And because I think that's closer to the time fights should actually take. Assassin v mage/ADC obviously shouldn't be that long, but I'd argue ADC/Mage/Tank v. Assassin should have that as the extreme end of the average time-frame for a fight
EDIT: Mostly the extreme range for Tank v. damage fights. Assassin DPS should be generally singe target.

No Comment on ADC
Or Supports


But Tanks. Unfortunately, Riot wants tanks to damage despite that being the main issue anytime we hit a tank meta. Honestly, tank meta should be great. I'd argue it is the default most balanced state. Except Riot still wants tanks to kill people in the same time-frame as other champions.

Going by before, a fight or duel with a tank should always be significantly longer. 
My basic opinion for tanks is that if the tank can't realize he's losing and actively run away from most things damage wise, there's a problem. Is not killing him annoying? Yes. But guess what: he's not defending anything anymore.
Tanks are generally geared toward the strategy part of the game, not the mechanics part.


Speaking of defending, do not even get me started on towers


Of course, that's just my ... hmmm ... I'm going to say 5 cents; it's a little much for just 2.

The problem with tanks wanting longer fights is that it's not actually that great for them unless they have some sort of sustain to outlast their target. 

Otherwise they're going to fight a losing battle because they can only take so many rotations before they die unless they actually can fight their target with the damage to kill. It shouldn't be one shot levels or super quick (unless the enemy is really behind).

That is the point, yes
Fights against tanks should take longer because both sides will be dealing less damage
But both should be able to win, dependent on how the people play

But Riot generally makes it so fights with tanks are only slightly longer precisely because they give them more damage.
It's a dumb balance idea based on the assumption that tanks players want to kill things. That's what bruisers are for, most tank players just want to tank, and everyone else can fuck off for the sake of balance.

Tank v. Tank really shouldn't end in death unless one side is extremely stupid

So you're only arguing for tank vs tank fights should last long?

And I won't speak for all tank players, but I want to do more than just tank. I want my laning phase to not be huddling under my tower because any trade will result in me wasting mana on someone I can't kill but who can kill me.

Yes, and partially because you can't balance the rest of it without having this be the outcome

Point 2:
Tanking is also CC, engage, peel, etc. Damage is the primary thing that should be absent

But that's the key that Riot isn't getting
You shouldn't huddle under turret. Fighting you in lane should be a continual process. If they stay at long enough and well enough, then that should force you off.
You should be able to counter if you want to and put back ... something (not going to saying who wins the fight, and ideally it would be skill based)
But it's not a once or twice and done thing. It's a do you care enough about denying me to keep fighting me and can you do it while still CSing. And can I make you miss CS while fighting back
Regen and pots are also factors to consider


The problem is laning usually comes from runes (even in the new system), so being able to shrug off your opponent for a significant time would likely create issues. Carries (specifically late game carries) would take them and scale with CS, not caring about the loss of power later.
Unless they create enough later power in runes to compensate.


It's an interesting problem but the basic idea is that tanks should slow things down, at least in regards to themselves.


As a note, I'm assuming were talking about top lane, though the issues (and there solutions) could spill over and create problems in other lanes.

Mage are gated by their mana early game, but are generally expected to build around it. 
Which is actually a very useful power control tool. If a mage is designed to need to build 3 mana recovery items to avoid being gated by their mana, then they're buying non-optimal damage items. 

Mana is still a power gate, but one that i think shouldn't exist only on mages. All champions should get some degree of limited resource in the early game that they need to compensate for in their build.

If the weaknesses are defined too clearly and champions have no leeway, that means the strengths need to be absolutely absurd. At which point, why not just play DotA? 
If you don't like that a mage can still dent you after you didn't capitalize on their CDs? 
If you don't like some assassins' telegraphed burst? 
If you don't like that ADCs will kill you if you let them walk forward? 
If you don't like ... which tank isn't gated by clarity? Which *champion* isn't?
